info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 03 at 8:57PM EST until February 04 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern Erie, Crawford and Southern Erie counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong north to northeast winds will produce blowing and drifting snow which could significantly reduce visibilities and impact roadways, especially east-west oriented roadways. Low temperatures tonight will reach the low to mid to upper teens with wind chill values in the mid single digits.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
